  <script id="jquery-js-after" type="text/javascript">
   (function () {
            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
                      var item = headers[i];
                      item.style.paddingTop = headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px";
                  }

                    var languageSwitcher = document.querySelector('.mesmerize-language-switcher');

                    if(languageSwitcher){
                        languageSwitcher.style.top = "calc( " +  headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px + 1rem)" ;
                    }
                    
                }, 100);

             
            }

            window.addEventListener('resize', setHeaderTopSpacing);
            window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing = setHeaderTopSpacing
            mesmerizeDomReady(setHeaderTopSpacing);
        })();
  </script>

          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <p class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            - European Masters Program -
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-efd8057 elementor-hidden-mobile elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="efd8057" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h2 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            Language & Communication Technologies
           </h2>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-08fda23 elementor-align-center ha-css-transform-yes elementor-widget__width-auto elementor-absolute elementor-hidden-mobile elementor-widget elementor-widget-button" data-element_type="widget" data-id="08fda23" data-settings='{"_position":"absolute"}' data-widget_type="button.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <div class="elementor-button-wrapper">
            <a class="elementor-button-link elementor-button elementor-size-sm elementor-animation-grow" href="#frontpage" role="button">
             <span class="elementor-button-content-wrapper">
              <span class="elementor-button-icon elementor-align-icon-left">
               <i aria-hidden="true" class="hm hm-arrow-left">
               </i>
              </span>
              <span class="elementor-button-text">
               Scroll
              </span>
             </span>
            </a>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-556bf9c9 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="556bf9c9" data-settings='{"_ha_eqh_enable":""}'>
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-35deae03" data-element_type="column" data-id="35deae03">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-3e8f791 elementor-widget elementor-widget-elementskit-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="3e8f791" data-widget_type="elementskit-heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <div class="ekit-wid-con">
            <div class="ekit-heading elementskit-section-title-wraper text_center ekit_heading_tablet- ekit_heading_mobile-">
             <h2 class="ekit-heading--title elementskit-section-title">
              Language & Communication Technologies
             </h2>
             <div class="ekit_heading_separetor_wraper ekit_heading_elementskit-border-divider">
              <div class="elementskit-border-divider">
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-e0d58f7 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="e0d58f7" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <p>
            The Erasmus Mundus European Masters Program in Language and Communication Technologies (LCT) is designed to meet the demands of industry and research in a rapidly growing area. It offers education and training opportunities for the next generations of leaders in research and innovation. It provides students with profound knowledge and insight into the various disciplines that contribute to the methods of language and communication technologies and it strengthens their ability to work according to scientific methods. Moreover, the students acquire practice-oriented knowledge by choosing appropriate combinations of modules in Language Technology, Computational and Theoretical Linguistics, and Computer Science. The LCT program prepares professionals to work in the areas of Natural Language Processing (NLP), Artificial Intelligence (AI), Deep Learning and other related fields.
           </p>
           <p>
            The LCT program involves studying one year each at two different European universities of the consortium. After completing all study requirements, the student will obtain two Master of Science/Arts degrees approved in the respective countries of issue.
           </p>
           <p>
            The LCT Masters Program has been successfully implemented since 2006, being funded by the Erasmus Mundus Programme from 2007 to 2011 and from 2013 to 2017. In 2012 the LCT Program operated as an Erasmus Mundus Brand Name. The intakes 2018 and 2019 were self-funding intakes, however, the program committed to respecting the Erasmus Mundus requirements and to maintaining the high quality of the implementation as during the years of funding. In 2020 LCT received the Erasmus Mundus grant again for the implementation of four intakes: 2020 to 2023. The intake 2024 is a self-funding intake as well as the upcoming intake 2025.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-3ae32d1 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="3ae32d1" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <p>
            <b>
             Type of degree
            </b>
            :
            <br/>
            Double Degree
           </p>
           <p>
            <b>
             Duration
            </b>
            :
            <br/>
            2 years
           </p>
           <p>
            <b>
             Student mobility tracks
            </b>
            :
            <br/>
            Every student studies one year each at two different European consortium partner universities.
           </p>
           <p>
            <b>
             Language of instruction
            </b>
            :
            <br/>
            English
           </p>
           <p>
            <b>
             Tuition fees
            </b>
            :
            <br/>
            8,500 Euro per year for non-EU students
            <br/>
            4,250 Euro per year for EU students
           </p>
           <p>
            <b>
             Scholarship scheme
            </b>
            :
            <br/>
            Erasmus Mundus scholarships were available for the intakes 2020 to 2023.
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             The Internal Summer School
            </strong>
            takes place in late August each year for one week for all students.
           </p>
           <p>
            For first-year students the primary focus will be on joint induction: introduction of the administrative and organizational aspects of the LCT program, intercultural training, experience exchange with second-year students, study-related soft skills training, e.g., study and research methods, academic writing, presentation skills, teamwork and time management.
           </p>
           <p>
            For second-year students the Summer School will offer personal, professional, and career development training and support in relation to the realization of the Master’s thesis and the preparation for professional life after graduation. It will cover a selection of topics such as career management, networking, searching and applying for internships and jobs in industry and academia, fundraising, venture creation and entrepreneurship.
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             The Annual Meeting
            </strong>
            (AM) of the LCT program is organized each year around May/June at the site of one of the partners and takes two days. The AM is attended by all students, consortium representatives and guests from academia and industry; also the latest graduates and all alumni are invited. The program of the event includes student and joint student-staff sessions, invited lecturers, soft skills training, social activities, a student conference with a poster session, where all students have a chance to present their project works or thesis topics and last but not least the graduation ceremony.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>

  <script id="jquery-js-after" type="text/javascript">
   (function () {
            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
                      var item = headers[i];
                      item.style.paddingTop = headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px";
                  }

                    var languageSwitcher = document.querySelector('.mesmerize-language-switcher');

                    if(languageSwitcher){
                        languageSwitcher.style.top = "calc( " +  headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px + 1rem)" ;
                    }
                    
                }, 100);

             
            }

            window.addEventListener('resize', setHeaderTopSpacing);
            window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing = setHeaderTopSpacing
            mesmerizeDomReady(setHeaderTopSpacing);
        })();
  </script>

      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">

        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <section class="elementor-section elementor-inner-section elementor-element elementor-element-421f040 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="421f040" data-settings='{"_ha_eqh_enable":""}'>
          <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
           <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-inner-column elementor-element elementor-element-b3edd18" data-element_type="column" data-id="b3edd18">
            <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
             <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-3e8f791 elementor-widget elementor-widget-elementskit-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="3e8f791" data-widget_type="elementskit-heading.default">
              <div class="elementor-widget-container">
               <div class="ekit-wid-con">
                <div class="ekit-heading elementskit-section-title-wraper text_left ekit_heading_tablet- ekit_heading_mobile-">
                 <h2 class="ekit-heading--title elementskit-section-title">
                  Program Outline
                 </h2>
                 <div class="ekit_heading_separetor_wraper ekit_heading_elementskit-border-divider">
                  <div class="elementskit-border-divider">
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-677ae31 elementor-widget elementor-widget-elementskit-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="677ae31" data-widget_type="elementskit-heading.default">
              <div class="elementor-widget-container">
               <div class="ekit-wid-con">
                <div class="ekit-heading elementskit-section-title-wraper text_left ekit_heading_tablet- ekit_heading_mobile-">
                 <h2 class="ekit-heading--title elementskit-section-title">
                  Course structure
                 </h2>
                 <div class="ekit_heading_separetor_wraper ekit_heading_elementskit-border-divider">
                  <div class="elementskit-border-divider">
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-e0d58f7 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="e0d58f7" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
              <div class="elementor-widget-container">
               <p>
                The course consists of compulsory and advanced modules, complemented by a master’s thesis and internship, for a total of 120 ECTS credits.
               </p>
               <p>
                Students within the double degree program have to study at two institutions of the consortium. As such, they are jointly monitored by two lecturers (tutors), one from each institution. Each student has to develop a study plan with their tutors. This plan must be submitted for approval to the Joint Committee of the Consortium. The students have to successfully complete all the written and/or oral exams of the modules selected in the aforementioned study plan. The thesis is supervised by at least two supervisors, one from each host institution. The thesis is submitted at and should satisfy the regulations of both hosting institutions, and is assessed at both institutions.
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-565be54 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="565be54" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
              <div class="elementor-widget-container">
               <p>
                <b>
                 Summary of the study program
                </b>
                :
               </p>
               <p>
                The
                <strong>
                 modular
                </strong>
                curriculum consists of four components:
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-caebd45 elementor-widget elementor-widget-elementskit-accordion" data-element_type="widget" data-id="caebd45" data-widget_type="elementskit-accordion.default">
              <div class="elementor-widget-container">
               <div class="ekit-wid-con">
                <div class="elementskit-accordion accoedion-primary" id="accordion-67e535c25a51c">
                 <div class="elementskit-card">
                  <div class="elementskit-card-header" id="primaryHeading-0-caebd45">
                   <a aria-controls="Collapse-bc2283067e535c25a51c" aria-expanded="true" class="ekit-accordion--toggler elementskit-btn-link collapsed" data-ekit-toggle="collapse" data-target="#Collapse-bc2283067e535c25a51c" href="#collapse-bc2283067e535c25a51c">
                    <div class="ekit_accordion_icon_left_group">
                     <div class="ekit_accordion_normal_icon">
                      <!-- Normal Icon -->
                      <i aria-hidden="true" class="icon icon-arrow-down icon-open icon-left">
                      </i>
                     </div>
                     <div class="ekit_accordion_active_icon">
                      <!-- Active Icon -->
                      <i aria-hidden="true" class="icon icon-arrow-up icon-closed icon-left">
                      </i>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <span class="ekit-accordion-title">
                     (A) Core modules
                    </span>
                   </a>
                  </div>
                  <div aria-labelledby="primaryHeading-0-caebd45" class="show collapse" data-parent="#accordion-67e535c25a51c" id="Collapse-bc2283067e535c25a51c">
                   <div class="elementskit-card-body ekit-accordion--content">
                    <p>
                     <strong>
                      Core modules
                     </strong>
                     ensure that the students obtain a solid common foundation designed to cover all areas necessary for working in LCT, including theoretical as well as practical skills; the number of credits for the various modules differs depending on the students’ background. Core modules are normally taken during the first year.
                    </p>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <!-- .elementskit-card END -->
                 <div class="elementskit-card">
                  <div class="elementskit-card-header" id="primaryHeading-1-caebd45">
                   <a aria-controls="Collapse-8417e7167e535c25a51c" aria-expanded="false" class="ekit-accordion--toggler elementskit-btn-link collapsed" data-ekit-toggle="collapse" data-target="#Collapse-8417e7167e535c25a51c" href="#collapse-8417e7167e535c25a51c">
                    <div class="ekit_accordion_icon_left_group">
                     <div class="ekit_accordion_normal_icon">
                      <!-- Normal Icon -->
                      <i aria-hidden="true" class="icon icon-arrow-down icon-open icon-left">
                      </i>
                     </div>
                     <div class="ekit_accordion_active_icon">
                      <!-- Active Icon -->
                      <i aria-hidden="true" class="icon icon-arrow-up icon-closed icon-left">
                      </i>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <span class="ekit-accordion-title">
                     (B) Specialized modules
                    </span>
                   </a>
                  </div>
                  <div aria-labelledby="primaryHeading-1-caebd45" class="collapse" data-parent="#accordion-67e535c25a51c" id="Collapse-8417e7167e535c25a51c">
                   <div class="elementskit-card-body ekit-accordion--content">
                    <p>
                     <strong>
                      Specialized modules
                     </strong>
                     complement the common core. We offer three tracks with different prerequisites that prepare students for various career possibilities.
                    </p>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <!-- .elementskit-card END -->
                 <div class="elementskit-card">
                  <div class="elementskit-card-header" id="primaryHeading-2-caebd45">
                   <a aria-controls="Collapse-3dad4e067e535c25a51c" aria-expanded="false" class="ekit-accordion--toggler elementskit-btn-link collapsed" data-ekit-toggle="collapse" data-target="#Collapse-3dad4e067e535c25a51c" href="#collapse-3dad4e067e535c25a51c">
                    <div class="ekit_accordion_icon_left_group">
                     <div class="ekit_accordion_normal_icon">
                      <!-- Normal Icon -->
                      <i aria-hidden="true" class="icon icon-arrow-down icon-open icon-left">
                      </i>
                     </div>
                     <div class="ekit_accordion_active_icon">
                      <!-- Active Icon -->
                      <i aria-hidden="true" class="icon icon-arrow-up icon-closed icon-left">
                      </i>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <span class="ekit-accordion-title">
                     (C) Free choice courses, soft skills courses and an internship
                    </span>
                   </a>
                  </div>
                  <div aria-labelledby="primaryHeading-2-caebd45" class="collapse" data-parent="#accordion-67e535c25a51c" id="Collapse-3dad4e067e535c25a51c">
                   <div class="elementskit-card-body ekit-accordion--content">
                    <p>
                     <b>
                      Free choice courses, soft skills courses and an internship
                     </b>
                     respectively offer the possibility to acquire additional specialized knowledge reflecting current trends/topics, hot research and employment areas. This module also gives students the opportunity to develop their soft skills, get real-world experience, and learn about working in a company or research lab, either inside or outside of consortium partners.
                    </p>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <!-- .elementskit-card END -->
                 <div class="elementskit-card">
                  <div class="elementskit-card-header" id="primaryHeading-3-caebd45">
                   <a aria-controls="Collapse-9a35f9867e535c25a51c" aria-expanded="false" class="ekit-accordion--toggler elementskit-btn-link collapsed" data-ekit-toggle="collapse" data-target="#Collapse-9a35f9867e535c25a51c" href="#collapse-9a35f9867e535c25a51c">
                    <div class="ekit_accordion_icon_left_group">
                     <div class="ekit_accordion_normal_icon">
                      <!-- Normal Icon -->
                      <i aria-hidden="true" class="icon icon-arrow-down icon-open icon-left">
                      </i>
                     </div>
                     <div class="ekit_accordion_active_icon">
                      <!-- Active Icon -->
                      <i aria-hidden="true" class="icon icon-arrow-up icon-closed icon-left">
                      </i>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <span class="ekit-accordion-title">
                     (D) Joint program events
                    </span>
                   </a>
                  </div>
                  <div aria-labelledby="primaryHeading-3-caebd45" class="collapse" data-parent="#accordion-67e535c25a51c" id="Collapse-9a35f9867e535c25a51c">
                   <div class="elementskit-card-body ekit-accordion--content">
                    <p>
                     <strong>
                      Joint program events
                     </strong>
                     such as the Summer School and the Annual Meeting are occasions during which students acquire additional (hard and soft) skills and have opportunities for networking with other students and with the associated partners. The Internal Summer School takes place before the start of each academic year, whereas the Annual Meeting is in May or June.
                    </p>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <!-- .elementskit-card END -->
                 <div class="elementskit-card">
                  <div class="elementskit-card-header" id="primaryHeading-4-caebd45">
                   <a aria-controls="Collapse-70f2ae267e535c25a51c" aria-expanded="false" class="ekit-accordion--toggler elementskit-btn-link collapsed" data-ekit-toggle="collapse" data-target="#Collapse-70f2ae267e535c25a51c" href="#collapse-70f2ae267e535c25a51c">
                    <div class="ekit_accordion_icon_left_group">
                     <div class="ekit_accordion_normal_icon">
                      <!-- Normal Icon -->
                      <i aria-hidden="true" class="icon icon-arrow-down icon-open icon-left">
                      </i>
                     </div>
                     <div class="ekit_accordion_active_icon">
                      <!-- Active Icon -->
                      <i aria-hidden="true" class="icon icon-arrow-up icon-closed icon-left">
                      </i>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <span class="ekit-accordion-title">
                     (E) Master's thesis
                    </span>
                   </a>
                  </div>
                  <div aria-labelledby="primaryHeading-4-caebd45" class="collapse" data-parent="#accordion-67e535c25a51c" id="Collapse-70f2ae267e535c25a51c">
                   <div class="elementskit-card-body ekit-accordion--content">
                    <p>
                     <strong>
                      The Master's thesis
                     </strong>
                     rounds off the learning experience with an independent project, which can be carried out at the university or as an internship.
                    </p>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <!-- .elementskit-card END -->
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-db2c1a9 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="db2c1a9" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
              <div class="elementor-widget-container">
               <p>
                A schematic overview of the program is given in the table. Beyond the obligatory common core, this modular curriculum structure allows the students to follow a study plan tailored to their background, interests and preferences.
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-7928106 elementor-widget elementor-widget-image" data-element_type="widget" data-id="7928106" data-widget_type="image.default">
              <div class="elementor-widget-container">
               <img alt="" class="attachment-large size-large" height="380" sizes="(max-width: 598px) 100vw, 598px" src="/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/lctimage.jpg" srcset="/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/lctimage.jpg 598w, /wp-content/uploads/2021/09/lctimage-300x191.jpg 300w" width="598"/>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-063e1d3 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="063e1d3" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
              <div class="elementor-widget-container">
               <p>
                The specialization tracks are characterized as follows:
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-5da92c2 elementor-widget elementor-widget-elementskit-accordion" data-element_type="widget" data-id="5da92c2" data-widget_type="elementskit-accordion.default">
              <div class="elementor-widget-container">
               <div class="ekit-wid-con">
                <div class="elementskit-accordion accoedion-primary" id="accordion-67e535c25ceae">
                 <div class="elementskit-card">
                  <div class="elementskit-card-header" id="primaryHeading-0-5da92c2">
                   <a aria-controls="Collapse-bc2283067e535c25ceae" aria-expanded="true" class="ekit-accordion--toggler elementskit-btn-link collapsed" data-ekit-toggle="collapse" data-target="#Collapse-bc2283067e535c25ceae" href="#collapse-bc2283067e535c25ceae">
                    <div class="ekit_accordion_icon_left_group">
                     <div class="ekit_accordion_normal_icon">
                      <!-- Normal Icon -->
                      <i aria-hidden="true" class="icon icon-arrow-down icon-open icon-left">
                      </i>
                     </div>
                     <div class="ekit_accordion_active_icon">
                      <!-- Active Icon -->
                      <i aria-hidden="true" class="icon icon-arrow-up icon-closed icon-left">
                      </i>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <span class="ekit-accordion-title">
                     Digital Language Resources
                    </span>
                   </a>
                  </div>
                  <div aria-labelledby="primaryHeading-0-5da92c2" class="show collapse" data-parent="#accordion-67e535c25ceae" id="Collapse-bc2283067e535c25ceae">
                   <div class="elementskit-card-body ekit-accordion--content">
                    <p>
                     <strong>
                      Digital Language Resources
                     </strong>
                     (DLR) track equips students having a strong linguistics background with the kind of insights and practical skills required to design, create and exploit annotated data resources for natural language applications or for the empirical validation of issues in cognitive and experimental linguistics.
                    </p>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <!-- .elementskit-card END -->
                 <div class="elementskit-card">
                  <div class="elementskit-card-header" id="primaryHeading-1-5da92c2">
                   <a aria-controls="Collapse-8417e7167e535c25ceae" aria-expanded="false" class="ekit-accordion--toggler elementskit-btn-link collapsed" data-ekit-toggle="collapse" data-target="#Collapse-8417e7167e535c25ceae" href="#collapse-8417e7167e535c25ceae">
                    <div class="ekit_accordion_icon_left_group">
                     <div class="ekit_accordion_normal_icon">
                      <!-- Normal Icon -->
                      <i aria-hidden="true" class="icon icon-arrow-down icon-open icon-left">
                      </i>
                     </div>
                     <div class="ekit_accordion_active_icon">
                      <!-- Active Icon -->
                      <i aria-hidden="true" class="icon icon-arrow-up icon-closed icon-left">
                      </i>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <span class="ekit-accordion-title">
                     Natural Language Algorithms and Applications (NLA)
                    </span>
                   </a>
                  </div>
                  <div aria-labelledby="primaryHeading-1-5da92c2" class="collapse" data-parent="#accordion-67e535c25ceae" id="Collapse-8417e7167e535c25ceae">
                   <div class="elementskit-card-body ekit-accordion--content">
                    <p>
                     <strong>
                      Natural Language Algorithms and Applications
                     </strong>
                     (NLA) track, intended mainly for students with a computer science background, revolves around the design and implementation of algorithms and machine learning techniques that are relevant to fundamental natural language processing problems such as parsing, generation, translation, as well as more advanced applications and platforms that make use of such algorithms.
                    </p>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <!-- .elementskit-card END -->
                 <div class="elementskit-card">
                  <div class="elementskit-card-header" id="primaryHeading-2-5da92c2">
                   <a aria-controls="Collapse-3dad4e067e535c25ceae" aria-expanded="false" class="ekit-accordion--toggler elementskit-btn-link collapsed" data-ekit-toggle="collapse" data-target="#Collapse-3dad4e067e535c25ceae" href="#collapse-3dad4e067e535c25ceae">
                    <div class="ekit_accordion_icon_left_group">
                     <div class="ekit_accordion_normal_icon">
                      <!-- Normal Icon -->
                      <i aria-hidden="true" class="icon icon-arrow-down icon-open icon-left">
                      </i>
                     </div>
                     <div class="ekit_accordion_active_icon">
                      <!-- Active Icon -->
                      <i aria-hidden="true" class="icon icon-arrow-up icon-closed icon-left">
                      </i>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <span class="ekit-accordion-title">
                     Language Data Science (LDS)
                    </span>
                   </a>
                  </div>
                  <div aria-labelledby="primaryHeading-2-5da92c2" class="collapse" data-parent="#accordion-67e535c25ceae" id="Collapse-3dad4e067e535c25ceae">
                   <div class="elementskit-card-body ekit-accordion--content">
                    <p>
                     The
                     <strong>
                      Language Data Science
                     </strong>
                     (LDS) track is aimed at students with a strong background in computer science and mathematics, familiar with AI approaches. It focuses on the application of Data Science techniques to large quantities of language data of different types and granularities in order to address important practical tasks such as information extraction, sentiment analysis, speech recognition, data visualisation etc.
                    </p>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <!-- .elementskit-card END -->
                 <div class="elementskit-card">
                  <div class="elementskit-card-header" id="primaryHeading-3-5da92c2">
                   <a aria-controls="Collapse-9a35f9867e535c25ceae" aria-expanded="false" class="ekit-accordion--toggler elementskit-btn-link collapsed" data-ekit-toggle="collapse" data-target="#Collapse-9a35f9867e535c25ceae" href="#collapse-9a35f9867e535c25ceae">
                    <div class="ekit_accordion_icon_left_group">
                     <div class="ekit_accordion_normal_icon">
                      <!-- Normal Icon -->
                      <i aria-hidden="true" class="icon icon-arrow-down icon-open icon-left">
                      </i>
                     </div>
                     <div class="ekit_accordion_active_icon">
                      <!-- Active Icon -->
                      <i aria-hidden="true" class="icon icon-arrow-up icon-closed icon-left">
                      </i>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <span class="ekit-accordion-title">
                     Modules and learning outcomes
                    </span>
                   </a>
                  </div>
                  <div aria-labelledby="primaryHeading-3-5da92c2" class="collapse" data-parent="#accordion-67e535c25ceae" id="Collapse-9a35f9867e535c25ceae">
                   <div class="elementskit-card-body ekit-accordion--content">
                    <p>
                     The LCT curriculum consists of coursework and an internship (90 ECTS) plus a Master's thesis (30 ECTS). Courses are primarily distributed over the first three semesters, while most of the work on the Master's thesis is completed in the fourth semester. This results in a 2-year program of 120 ECTS. The students study one year each at two universities of the consortium. The benefits of such a program are twofold: (a) scientifically, it brings students in contact with two different research environments and different areas of specialization; and (b) culturally, it brings students in contact with two different societies which, crucially in our case, also mainly do research on (at least) two different languages (given the topic of the Master's thesis, multilinguality is considered a key issue).
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     Students in LCT need knowledge of a wide range of topics in linguistics, computer science, mathematics and natural language processing as well as the ability to design, develop, and evaluate applications that crucially rely on language technology (skills and competence). To ensure that each student has sufficient and comparable knowledge and skills, we have identified 6 foundational areas (adding up to 30 ECTS) in Natural Language Processing (NLP) covered by core modules. The core modules aim at establishing the “lingua franca” for all students attending the program, independently of their previous background. In addition, students need to select one specialization track and cover the topics of each of the three modules within the chosen track (adding up to 30 ECTS). Each track consists of three specialized modules (adding up to 30 ECTS) with a minimum of 6 ECTS and a maximum of 15 ECTS. An additional 30 ECTS are acquired by free choice (10-15 ECTS) and soft-skills (5-9 ECTS) courses (e.g., scientific communication, writing and defending grant proposals, career perspectives, etc.) and an internship (6-15 ECTS).
                    </p>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <!-- .elementskit-card END -->
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </section>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
    </div>

  <script id="jquery-js-after" type="text/javascript">
   (function () {
            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
                      var item = headers[i];
                      item.style.paddingTop = headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px";
                  }

                    var languageSwitcher = document.querySelector('.mesmerize-language-switcher');

                    if(languageSwitcher){
                        languageSwitcher.style.top = "calc( " +  headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px + 1rem)" ;
                    }
                    
                }, 100);

             
            }

            window.addEventListener('resize', setHeaderTopSpacing);
            window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing = setHeaderTopSpacing
            mesmerizeDomReady(setHeaderTopSpacing);
        })();
  </script>

                      </b>
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      <b>
                       <a href="http://www.uni-saarland.de/" target="_blank">
                        Saarland University in Saarbrücken
                       </a>
                      </b>
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      At Saarland University (USAAR), the EM-LCT programme is run by the Department of Language Science and Technology (LST) and is integrated in the local MSc. programme of the same name: https://www.uni-saarland.de/en/department/lst/studies.html. The chairs of the department cover a wide range of linguistics and language technologies: computational linguistics, psycholinguistics, phonetics, digital signal processing, general linguistics, translation studies, machine translation. There is a strong link to the Department of Multilinguality and Language Technology at the German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence (DFKI) (http://www.dfki.de). The current research flagship is the Collaborative Research Centre (SFB) on "Information Density and Linguistic Encoding" (http://www.sfb1102.uni-saarland.de) that consists of several research projects with international significance.

                       </a>
                      </b>
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      At the University of Lorraine, the LCT program is part of the master's degree in natural language processing (NLP) at the IDMC (Institute of digital sciences and cognition). The NLP master's program focuses on computer aided data processing in natural languages, such as text, speech and knowledge processing. The training follows a regular structure that puts emphasis on projects throughout the year. It shares courses with two other masters' programs: the master's in Cognitive Sciences for methods and tools in artificial intelligence and computer science, and the master's on Language Sciences for linguistic aspects. Another Erasmus Mundus program in Lexicology also integrates courses from the NLP master's program. Students are part of an ecosystem that is supported by two laboratories, Loria (https://www.loria.fr/en/) and Atilf (https://www.atilf.fr/), which promotes broad thematic open-mindedness while providing a solid thematic anchoring in computer science, linguistics, neural networks, resources, and applications for language data processing.

                        LCT at the University of Groningen
                       </a>
                      </b>
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      The EM-LCT program at the University of Groningen is part of the Research Master Linguistics. It has strong connections with the Master in Information Science, which has a strong Natural Language Processing track, and Artificial Intelligence. Most courses are taught in combination with one of these programs, which means that work forms can vary from consisting primarily of lectures for large audiences to team work dedicated to a specific topic. Within the LCT program, Groningen offers courses for the Natural Language Algorithms and Applications (NLA) and Digital Language Resources (DLR) tracks. The staff of EM-LCT specializes in research on computational semantics, social media, syntactic parsing, machine translation, multi-lingual approaches, and NLP for legal purposes. In recent years, several LCT alumni have continued as PhD at the Information Science group.

                      </b>
                      <br/>
                      <b>
                       <a href="http://ufal.mff.cuni.cz/lct/modules" target="_blank">
                        Inofficial notes for LCT students submitting the thesis at Charles University.
                       </a>
                      </b>
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      Charles University, founded in 1348, is a leading research university in the Czech Republic. The EM-LCT program is hosted by the Institute of Formal and Applied Linguistics, Faculty of Mathematics and Physics. We prepare our graduates for research in the broad area of natural language processing (NLP) as well as for the development of applications dealing with both written and spoken language. We can offer a wide range of courses ranging from advanced computer science courses focusing on mathematical and algorithmic foundations of NLP through courses offering state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to courses focusing on broad NLP tasks, such as, e.g., text and speech processing, information retrieval, machine translation, and dialogue systems. In all areas, we foster international cooperation and active and broad participation of LCT students in our research projects.

Therefore, we welcome students with very good knowledge of computer science or mathematics interested esp. in the Natural Language Algorithms and Applications and Language Data Science LCT tracks.

                      <br/>
                      At the University of the Basque Country (UPV/EHU), the EM-LCT program is hosted by the IXA research group (http://ixa.eus) and HiTZ, the Basque Center for Language Technology (http://www.hitz.eus). The key cornerstones in our program are Applied Natural language processing and understanding (NLP/NLU), together with advanced data science, mainly applied to text but also to speech. Available study units range from advanced computer science to multi-disciplinary natural language processing, putting emphasis on experimentation but without leaving aside linguistic aspects. Our academic staff is notable for its commitment to research and for awakening research interest in our students. Researchers from 6 departments are involved in the teaching program leading to a wide range of expertise that translate into alternative multi-disciplinary possibilities for the master thesis. Classes are small, enabling close interaction. The Computer Science Faculty is located in San Sebastian, a green city by the sea at the feet of the Pyrenees that hosts several companies and technological institutes dealing with NLP. Our areas of expertise include: advanced deep neural machine translation, multi-modal natural language understanding, speech processing and speech generation, acquisition and annotation of language resources, NLP for lesser-resourced language like Basque.
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-33 elementor-inner-column elementor-element elementor-element-70b067c" data-element_type="column" data-id="70b067c" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>
            <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
             <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-fa17924 elementor-widget elementor-widget-elementskit-team" data-element_type="widget" data-id="fa17924" data-widget_type="elementskit-team.default">
              <div class="elementor-widget-container">
               <div class="ekit-wid-con">
                <div class="profile-square-v square-v4 elementor-animation- ekit-team-style-hover_info">
                 <div class="profile-card text-center">
                  <div class="profile-header ekit-team-img" data-target="#ekit_team_modal_fa17924" data-toggle="modal">
                   <img alt="marchio_unitrento_colore_it" src="/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/marchio_unitrento_colore_it.png"/>
                  </div>
                  <!-- .profile-header END -->
                  <div class="profile-body">
                   <h2 class="profile-title">
                    <a class="ekit-team-popup" data-mfp-src="#ekit_team_modal_fa17924" href="javascript:void(0)">
                     LCT at the University of Trento
                    </a>
                   </h2>
                   <p class="profile-designation">
                    European partner (until August 2025)
                   </p>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div aria-hidden="true" class="zoom-anim-dialog mfp-hide elementskit-team-popup" id="ekit_team_modal_fa17924" role="dialog" tabindex="-1">

                  <div class="modal-content">

                   </button>
                   <div class="modal-body">
                    <div class="ekit-team-modal-img">
                     <img alt="marchio_unitrento_colore_it" src="/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/marchio_unitrento_colore_it.png"/>
                    </div>
                    <div class="ekit-team-modal-info has-img">
                     <h2 class="ekit-team-modal-title">
                      LCT at the University of Trento
                     </h2>
                     <p class="ekit-team-modal-position">
                      European partner (until August 2025)
                     </p>
                     <div class="ekit-team-modal-content">
                      <b>
                       <a href="https://www.cimec.unitn.it/en">
                        Center for Mind/Brain Sciences (CIMeC), University of Trento (UniTN), Italy.
                       </a>
                      </b>
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      <b>
                       <a href="https://international.unitn.it/mcs/lct-european-masters-program">
                        LCT at the University of Trento
                       </a>
                      </b>
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      <b>
                       <a href="https://offertaformativa.unitn.it/en/lm/cognitive-science/graduation" target="_blank">
                        Guide to thesis submission
                       </a>
                      </b>
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      The particular strength of the University of Trento, which distinguishes it from those offered by the other partners of the LCT, is the chance to study topics in Cognitive Neuroscience and Neuroimaging while acquiring a solid theoretical and computational background in foundational and cutting-edge LCT topics, like Computational Semantics and Language and Vision integration, with methods that span symbolic approaches, theory-driven language modeling and deep learning. Theoretical knowledge will be supplemented by the experience acquired in substantial practical projects carried out in research and industry labs.
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>

                     LCT at the University of Malta
                    </a>
                   </h2>
                   <p class="profile-designation">
                    European partner (until August 2025)
                   </p>

                <div aria-hidden="true" class="zoom-anim-dialog mfp-hide elementskit-team-popup" id="ekit_team_modal_449a2f2" role="dialog" tabindex="-1">

                   <div class="modal-body">
                    <div class="ekit-team-modal-img">
                     <img alt="uom-malta-logo" src="/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/uom-malta-logo.png"/>
                    </div>
                    <div class="ekit-team-modal-info has-img">
                     <h2 class="ekit-team-modal-title">
                      LCT at the University of Malta
                     </h2>
                     <p class="ekit-team-modal-position">
                      European partner (until August 2025)
                     </p>
                     <div class="ekit-team-modal-content">
                      <b>
                       <a href="http://www.um.edu.mt/ict/hlst" target="_blank">
                        Institute of Linguistics & Language Technology
                       </a>
                      </b>
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      <b>
                       <a href="http://www.um.edu.mt/" target="_blank">
                        University of Malta
                       </a>
                      </b>
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      <b>
                       <a href="https://www.um.edu.mt/courses/overview/pmschltft-2024-5-o/">
                        LCT at the University of Malta.
                       </a>
                      </b>
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      At the University of Malta, the EM-LCT program is co-hosted by two entities, namely the Department of Artificial Intelligence and the Institute of Linguistics and Language Technology. Thanks to this combination we can offer a wide range of study units and expertise to EM-LCT students that fully reflects the broad nature of the programme. Study units available range from advanced computer science through multi-disciplinary natural language processing (NLP) to experimental and theoretical linguistics. Regarding supervision, again the students have a choice among the wide range of profiles and expertise of our academic staff. Malta is a small island but our NLP community is very active, as reflected by the numerous EU-projects in which we participate. Classes are usually small, and although companies in the NLP field may not be as numerous as in other countries, the number is growing. Topics in which we specialise include: NLP for lesser-resourced language, natural language generation, language and vision, deep learning for NLP, distributional semantics, speech processing etc.

  <script id="jquery-js-after" type="text/javascript">
   (function () {
            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
                      var item = headers[i];
                      item.style.paddingTop = headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px";
                  }

                    var languageSwitcher = document.querySelector('.mesmerize-language-switcher');

                    if(languageSwitcher){
                        languageSwitcher.style.top = "calc( " +  headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px + 1rem)" ;
                    }
                    
                }, 100);

             
            }

            window.addEventListener('resize', setHeaderTopSpacing);
            window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing = setHeaderTopSpacing
            mesmerizeDomReady(setHeaderTopSpacing);
        })();
  </script>

             <div aria-controls="elementor-tab-content-7471" class="elementor-tab-title eael-accordion-header" data-tab="1" id="what-is-an-erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degree-what-is-its-added-value" role="tab" tabindex="7471">
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-accordion-icon fas fa-plus">
              </i>
              <span class="eael-accordion-tab-title">
               What is an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree? What is its added value?
              </span>
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-toggle fas fa-angle-right">
              </i>
             </div>
             <div aria-labelledby="what-is-an-erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degree-what-is-its-added-value" class="eael-accordion-content clearfix" data-tab="1" id="elementor-tab-content-7471" role="tabpanel">
              <p>
              </p>
              <p>
               Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degrees (EMJMDs) are integrated study programs at Masters level, designed to distinguish Europe as a center of excellence in higher education. (For a definition of an "integrated study programme", please see Question 3 below.) They are offered by at least three universities in three different European countries.
              </p>
              <p>
               Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degrees provide a distinctively European offer in higher education, which foresees a period of study in at least two universities in two different European countries. They result in the award of a double, a multiple or a joint degree recognised in the countries where the degree-awarding institutions are located. Moreover, they offer substantial study grants for top-quality graduate students and scholars, who enjoy high-quality hosting and welcome facilities while participating in an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree. Finally, Erasmus Mundus Masters consortia may establish partnerships with third-country universities, under which grants are awarded to EU graduate students and scholars who are enrolled in the respective Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree in order to study or work at the third-country partner university.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="eael-accordion-list">
             <div aria-controls="elementor-tab-content-7472" class="elementor-tab-title eael-accordion-header" data-tab="2" id="what-is-an-erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degree-consortium-and-how-does-it-work" role="tab" tabindex="7472">
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-accordion-icon fas fa-plus">
              </i>
              <span class="eael-accordion-tab-title">
               What is an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree consortium and how does it work?
              </span>
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-toggle fas fa-angle-right">
              </i>
             </div>
             <div aria-labelledby="what-is-an-erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degree-consortium-and-how-does-it-work" class="eael-accordion-content clearfix" data-tab="2" id="elementor-tab-content-7472" role="tabpanel">
              <p>
              </p>
              <p>
               An Erasmus Mundus Masters consortium is a group of at least three higher education institutions from three different European countries which has been selected to offer an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree under Action 1 of the EM programme. In cases where the consortium includes higher education institutions from an EEA/EFTA state or a candidate country, at least two of the participating institutions must be located in EU Member States.
              </p>
              <p>
               Each consortium has a coordinating institution which has a legal agreement with the Education, Audio-Visual & Culture Executive Agency (EACEA) on behalf of the consortium. Throughout the duration of the Erasmus Mundus Masters program, the coordinating institution is the Agency's contact partner who speaks and reports for the consortium. It is responsible for the financial management of the Erasmus Mundus Community funds paid to the consortium. However, the coordinating institution does not necessarily play a predominant role in the delivery of the master's program.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="eael-accordion-list">
             <div aria-controls="elementor-tab-content-7473" class="elementor-tab-title eael-accordion-header" data-tab="3" id="what-does-an-integrated-study-program-mean" role="tab" tabindex="7473">
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-accordion-icon fas fa-plus">
              </i>
              <span class="eael-accordion-tab-title">
               What does an "integrated study program" mean?
              </span>
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-toggle fas fa-angle-right">
              </i>
             </div>
             <div aria-labelledby="what-does-an-integrated-study-program-mean" class="eael-accordion-content clearfix" data-tab="3" id="elementor-tab-content-7473" role="tabpanel">
              <p>
              </p>
              <p>
               An integrated study program offered by an Erasmus Mundus Masters consortium has the following features:
              </p>
              <p>
               <b>
                Course integration
               </b>
               : delivery of a jointly developed curriculum or full recognition by the Erasmus Mundus Masters consortium of modules which are developed and delivered separately, but which together make up a common standard master's program.
              </p>
              <p>
               <b>
                Joint criteria for admission and examination
               </b>
               : students must be able to apply to a single program with common standards for admission, a common application procedure and a joint student selection process in accordance with the relevant national legislation in the countries of participating institutions. Entry requirements must be clearly described and common to the Master's program. Examinations passed at one institution of the Erasmus Mundus Master consortium are recognized fully and automatically by the other institutions of the consortium.
              </p>
              <p>
               <b>
                Mobility
               </b>
               : students must carry out a period of study in at least two of the participating institutions. The mobility at a second institution cannot be replaced by virtual mobility. Neither can this mobility take place in institutions outside the consortium. The sequence of study periods spent in the various hosting institutions and the various possible mobility combinations must be known at the time of application for the Master's program and made known to potential students in advance. In a minimum consortium of three partners (A, B, C), mobility combinations would normally be A+B, A+C, B+C or A+B+C. In cases where the consortium includes institutions from EEA-EFTA states, at least one of the hosting institutions must be located in a Member State.
              </p>
              <p>
               <b>
                Guaranteed award of a recognized joint, or a double or a multiple degree after the successful conclusion of the Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Program
               </b>
               : a clear definition of the nature and the form of the final degree(s) delivered is required. A double or multiple degree is defined as two or more nationally recognized diplomas issued officially by two or more institutions involved in an integrated study program. A joint degree is defined as a single diploma issued by at least two of the institutions offering an integrated study program. The possibility to deliver a double degree is a minimal requirement.
              </p>
              <p>
               <b>
                Common program fee
               </b>
               : Program fees, if any, must be common to the Master's program and must not depend on where the students start, continue or finish the Master's program. There can be two different tuition fee amounts for European students and non-European students. However, all overseas students must be treated in the same way regardless of their origin and whether or not they receive an Erasmus Mundus scholarship.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="eael-accordion-list">
             <div aria-controls="elementor-tab-content-7474" class="elementor-tab-title eael-accordion-header" data-tab="4" id="who-can-apply-to-erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degrees-how-is-a-course-at-masters-level-defined" role="tab" tabindex="7474">
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-accordion-icon fas fa-plus">
              </i>
              <span class="eael-accordion-tab-title">
               Who can apply to Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degrees? How is a course at Master's level defined?
              </span>
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-toggle fas fa-angle-right">
              </i>
             </div>
             <div aria-labelledby="who-can-apply-to-erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degrees-how-is-a-course-at-masters-level-defined" class="eael-accordion-content clearfix" data-tab="4" id="elementor-tab-content-7474" role="tabpanel">
              <p>
              </p>
              <p>
               Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degrees are open to graduate students having obtained a first university degree from a study lasting a minimum of three years. The specific admission conditions are defined by each Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree consortium.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="eael-accordion-list">
             <div aria-controls="elementor-tab-content-7475" class="elementor-tab-title eael-accordion-header" data-tab="5" id="what-is-the-duration-of-an-erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degree" role="tab" tabindex="7475">
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-accordion-icon fas fa-plus">
              </i>
              <span class="eael-accordion-tab-title">
               What is the duration of an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree?
              </span>
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-toggle fas fa-angle-right">
              </i>
             </div>
             <div aria-labelledby="what-is-the-duration-of-an-erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degree" class="eael-accordion-content clearfix" data-tab="5" id="elementor-tab-content-7475" role="tabpanel">
              <p>
              </p>
              <p>
               An Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree carries between a minimum of 60 and up to max. 120 ECTS credits at masters level. 60 to 120 ECTS credits correspond to courses lasting from one up to two academic years. Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degrees all use the ECTS (European Credit Transfer System) or equivalent systems.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="eael-accordion-list">
             <div aria-controls="elementor-tab-content-7476" class="elementor-tab-title eael-accordion-header" data-tab="6" id="does-erasmus-mundus-offer-scholarships-for-part-time-studies" role="tab" tabindex="7476">
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-accordion-icon fas fa-plus">
              </i>
              <span class="eael-accordion-tab-title">
               Does Erasmus Mundus offer scholarships for part-time studies?
              </span>
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-toggle fas fa-angle-right">
              </i>
             </div>
             <div aria-labelledby="does-erasmus-mundus-offer-scholarships-for-part-time-studies" class="eael-accordion-content clearfix" data-tab="6" id="elementor-tab-content-7476" role="tabpanel">
              <p>
              </p>
              <p>
               No, the Erasmus Mundus Scholarships are intended for full-time studies.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="eael-accordion-list">
             <div aria-controls="elementor-tab-content-7477" class="elementor-tab-title eael-accordion-header" data-tab="7" id="how-many-erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degrees-are-there-which-disciplines-or-subject-areas-are-covered" role="tab" tabindex="7477">
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-accordion-icon fas fa-plus">
              </i>
              <span class="eael-accordion-tab-title">
               How many Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degrees are there? Which disciplines or subject areas are covered?
              </span>
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-toggle fas fa-angle-right">
              </i>
             </div>
             <div aria-labelledby="how-many-erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degrees-are-there-which-disciplines-or-subject-areas-are-covered" class="eael-accordion-content clearfix" data-tab="7" id="elementor-tab-content-7477" role="tabpanel">
              <p>
              </p>
              <p>
               All fields of study and disciplines are covered; a complete list of Erasmus Mundus Joint Masters can be consulted
               <a href="https://www.eacea.ec.europa.eu/scholarships/erasmus-mundus-catalogue_en">
                here
               </a>
               .
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="eael-accordion-list">
             <div aria-controls="elementor-tab-content-7478" class="elementor-tab-title eael-accordion-header" data-tab="8" id="to-which-degrees-do-the-erasmus-joint-master-degrees-lead" role="tab" tabindex="7478">
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-accordion-icon fas fa-plus">
              </i>
              <span class="eael-accordion-tab-title">
               To which degrees do the Erasmus Joint Master Degrees lead?
              </span>
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-toggle fas fa-angle-right">
              </i>
             </div>
             <div aria-labelledby="to-which-degrees-do-the-erasmus-joint-master-degrees-lead" class="eael-accordion-content clearfix" data-tab="8" id="elementor-tab-content-7478" role="tabpanel">
              <p>
              </p>
              <p>
               Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degrees lead to the award of a recognized double, multiple or joint degree. A double degree is a minimum requirement. A double or multiple degree is defined as two or more national diplomas issued officially by two or more institutions involved in an integrated study program. A joint degree is defined as a single diploma issued by at least two of the institutions offering an integrated study program. The obtained degrees will be recognized in the countries where the degree-awarding institutions are located.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="eael-accordion-list">
             <div aria-controls="elementor-tab-content-7479" class="elementor-tab-title eael-accordion-header" data-tab="9" id="which-mobility-requirements-are-there-within-an-erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degree-and-to-whom-do-they-apply" role="tab" tabindex="7479">
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-accordion-icon fas fa-plus">
              </i>
              <span class="eael-accordion-tab-title">
               Which mobility requirements are there within an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree and to whom do they apply?
              </span>
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-toggle fas fa-angle-right">
              </i>
             </div>
             <div aria-labelledby="which-mobility-requirements-are-there-within-an-erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degree-and-to-whom-do-they-apply" class="eael-accordion-content clearfix" data-tab="9" id="elementor-tab-content-7479" role="tabpanel">
              <p>
              </p>
              <p>
               All students (European and non-European) following an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree are obliged to study in at least two of the European institutions offering the program. The sequence of study periods spent in the various institutions and the various possible mobility combinations must be known to potential students when they apply for the program. The length of the study period in each of the participating institutions can vary, but normally at least 30% of the program should be completed in a second institution.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="eael-accordion-list">
             <div aria-controls="elementor-tab-content-74710" class="elementor-tab-title eael-accordion-header" data-tab="10" id="which-welcome-and-housing-facilities-should-erasmus-mundus-masters-consortia-offer" role="tab" tabindex="74710">
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-accordion-icon fas fa-plus">
              </i>
              <span class="eael-accordion-tab-title">
               Which welcome and housing facilities should Erasmus Mundus Masters consortia offer?
              </span>
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-toggle fas fa-angle-right">
              </i>
             </div>
             <div aria-labelledby="which-welcome-and-housing-facilities-should-erasmus-mundus-masters-consortia-offer" class="eael-accordion-content clearfix" data-tab="10" id="elementor-tab-content-74710" role="tabpanel">
              <p>
              </p>
              <p>
               Each institution of an Erasmus Mundus Masters consortium should have an International Office with adequate opening hours and linguistic coverage. They should offer housing facilities, coaching, language support, activities aiming at social integration as well as assistance with residence permits and social insurance. These services must be of high quality.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="eael-accordion-list">
             <div aria-controls="elementor-tab-content-74711" class="elementor-tab-title eael-accordion-header" data-tab="11" id="how-many-places-does-the-erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degree-offer-for-third-country-students-and-visiting-scholars" role="tab" tabindex="74711">
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-accordion-icon fas fa-plus">
              </i>
              <span class="eael-accordion-tab-title">
               How many places does the Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree offer for third-country students and visiting scholars?
              </span>
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-toggle fas fa-angle-right">
              </i>
             </div>
             <div aria-labelledby="how-many-places-does-the-erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degree-offer-for-third-country-students-and-visiting-scholars" class="eael-accordion-content clearfix" data-tab="11" id="elementor-tab-content-74711" role="tabpanel">
              <p>
              </p>
              <p>
               Each selected Erasmus Mundus Masters consortium reserves a minimum number of places for third-country students and scholars: about 20 students and 4 scholars every year. Erasmus Mundus Masters consortia should ensure an appropriate balance in the distribution of these students and scholars between the partner institutions within the consortium.
              </p>
              <p>
               For intakes without Erasmus Mundus scholarships there are places specifically reserved for third-country students. All places are open for students from any countries.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="eael-accordion-list">
             <div aria-controls="elementor-tab-content-74712" class="elementor-tab-title eael-accordion-header" data-tab="12" id="can-european-students-also-do-an-erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degree" role="tab" tabindex="74712">
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-accordion-icon fas fa-plus">
              </i>
              <span class="eael-accordion-tab-title">
               Can European students also do an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master degree?
              </span>
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-toggle fas fa-angle-right">
              </i>
             </div>
             <div aria-labelledby="can-european-students-also-do-an-erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degree" class="eael-accordion-content clearfix" data-tab="12" id="elementor-tab-content-74712" role="tabpanel">
              <p>
              </p>
              <p>
               Yes, Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degrees must also be attended by European students and applying consortia must demonstrate that they have taken the necessary measures to ensure such participation.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="eael-accordion-list">
             <div aria-controls="elementor-tab-content-74713" class="elementor-tab-title eael-accordion-header" data-tab="13" id="my-current-degree-is-in-literature-language-and-education-or-translation-am-i-eligible-for-the-lct-program" role="tab" tabindex="74713">
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-accordion-icon fas fa-plus">
              </i>
              <span class="eael-accordion-tab-title">
               My current degree is in Literature, Language and Education, or Translation. Am I eligible for the LCT Program?
              </span>
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa-toggle fas fa-angle-right">
              </i>
             </div>
             <div aria-labelledby="my-current-degree-is-in-literature-language-and-education-or-translation-am-i-eligible-for-the-lct-program" class="eael-accordion-content clearfix" data-tab="13" id="elementor-tab-content-74713" role="tabpanel">
              <p>
              </p>
              <p>
               Formally, you are eligible to apply to the program with such a degree. The selection committee will carefully review your qualifications to determine whether your background in formal linguistics is sufficient to allow you to successfully participate in the program. Concerning your academic qualification given your degree, it depends how much formal linguistics the courses you followed have covered. It has often been the case so far, that courses for example at literature departments did not fulfill minimal requirements on the linguistics side. There were exceptions but in general literature students do not take the type of formal linguistics courses that are needed for computational linguistics. Catching up in both computer science and linguistics would be too much for the three to four semesters of courses our MSc students do. However, students from "hardcore" linguistics departments typically satisfy the requirements, and thus do not need to catch up on linguistics, only on computer science.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
    </div>
   </div>

  <script id="jquery-js-after" type="text/javascript">
   (function () {
            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
                      var item = headers[i];
                      item.style.paddingTop = headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px";
                  }

                    var languageSwitcher = document.querySelector('.mesmerize-language-switcher');

                    if(languageSwitcher){
                        languageSwitcher.style.top = "calc( " +  headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px + 1rem)" ;
                    }
                    
                }, 100);

             
            }

            window.addEventListener('resize', setHeaderTopSpacing);
            window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing = setHeaderTopSpacing
            mesmerizeDomReady(setHeaderTopSpacing);
        })();
  </script>

                    <p>
                     We are proud to announce that the paper "When your Rich Cousin Has the Right Connections: Unsupervised Bilingual Lexicon Induction for Related Data-Imbalanced Languages." by Niyati Bafna, Cristina España-Bonet, Josef van Genabith, Benoît Sagot and Rachel Bawden has won the best student paper award at LREC-Coling 2024. Niyati is an LCT graduate of the intake 2020 and currently she is doing her PhD at the Johns Hopkins Center for Language and Speech Processing.
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     Congratulations to Niyati Bafna and her co-authors!

   (function () {
            function setHeaderTopSpacing() {

                setTimeout(function() {
                  var headerTop = document.querySelector('.header-top');
                  var headers = document.querySelectorAll('.header-wrapper .header,.header-wrapper .header-homepage');

                  for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
                      var item = headers[i];
                      item.style.paddingTop = headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px";
                  }

                    var languageSwitcher = document.querySelector('.mesmerize-language-switcher');

                    if(languageSwitcher){
                        languageSwitcher.style.top = "calc( " +  headerTop.getBoundingClientRect().height + "px + 1rem)" ;
                    }
                    
                }, 100);

             
            }

            window.addEventListener('resize', setHeaderTopSpacing);
            window.mesmerizeSetHeaderTopSpacing = setHeaderTopSpacing
            mesmerizeDomReady(setHeaderTopSpacing);
        })();
  </script>
